ApplicationData.text: ASPRO 2 from JMMC is the new version of the ASPRO tool to prepare your interferometric observations with the VLTI or other interferometers.
ApplicationData.sampdescription: Prepare your interferometric observations with the VLTI or other interferometers

package.name: jMAL
package.description: JMMC library to provide common astronomical computations (coordinate conversion, SIMBAD star resolver and analytical object models in interferometry)

package.name: OIFits Explorer core
package.description: OIFits Explorer core is the JMMC library dedicated to share OIFits GUI components (plots)

package.name: OITools
package.description: OITools is the JMMC library dedicated to OIFits manipulation (load, save and validation)

package.name: JSkyCalc
package.description: Observability constraints and Sky Display based on JSkyCalc by J. R. Thorstensen, Dartmouth College
package.license: redistribution allowed including this acknowledgment 'Observability constraints and Sky Display based on JSkyCalc by J. R. Thorstensen, Dartmouth College'

package.name: nom.tam.fits
package.description: The Java FITS library (nom.tam.fits) has been developed which provides efficient I/O for FITS images and binary tables. Made by Dr Thomas A. McGlynn, HEASARC

package.name: JSAMP
package.description: JSAMP is a Java toolkit for use with the Simple Applications Messaging Protocol. Made by Mark Taylor, Bristol University.

package.name: CERN colt
package.description: provides a set of Open Source Libraries for High Performance Scientific and Technical Computing in Java
package.license: Copyright (c) 1999 CERN - European Organization for Nuclear Research

package.name: JTransforms
package.description: JTransforms is the first, open source, multithreaded FFT library written in pure Java. Made by Dr Piotr Wendykier, Wolfram Research, Inc.

package.name: JODK
package.description: Java Optimized Development Kit (JODK) is a performance-oriented Java general-purpose library, which treatments are extensions, additions (FastMath)

package.name: JFreeChart
package.description: JFreeChart is a free 100% Java chart library that makes it easy for developers to display professional quality charts in their applications

package.name: iText
package.description: iText is a library that allows you to generate PDF files on the fly

package.name: SteelSeries
package.description: SteelSeries is library of gauges for Java applications

prerelease.change: Enhanced export to PDF with multiple pages for large target lists

Added Fits cube loading support (AXIS3 represents wavelength axis)
Added minimal Fits CUNIT keyword support to handle angle and wavelength conversions (deg, arcsec to rad) and (nm or micron to meter)
Optimized OIFits computation from an user model (better parallelism)
Improved general performance (Best Pops, model image) using JODK FastMath
Enabled parallelization of the observability computation in multi configuration mode
Enhanced parallelization of the Best PoPs algorithm
Fixed NPE exception in Best Pops algorithm when targets never rise
Fixed the color scale on UV coverage plot to use degrees instead of radians when representing the model phase
Fixed OIFits viewer compatiblity with OpenJDK 1.6.24 and 1.7.x
Improved Pops GUI ie improved synchronization between Pops text field and Best Pops combo box
Changed Observability plot to show HA constraints, moon avoidance and wind restriction using translucent area and dotted outline
Added the symbol [i] after target names on the observability plot to indicate that this target has user notes and show its content in the observability tooltip
Reduced memory footprint used by Best PoPs algorithms
Added HA constraints (per target) in the observability computation displayed using translucent area and dotted outline
Added a combo box in the main settings to see estimated best Pops combinations and their effect on observability

Enhanced the Best PoPs algorithm to take new rules into account (transit distance and HA constraints); it is based on a normal law estimator that allows more control (gaussian variance and average estimation versus min estimation)
Optimized Best PoPs algorithm (multithreading)
Made the color scale on UV coverage plot interactive to show only effective data range (even when zooming in/out)
Added preferences for night only and best PoPs algorithms (Simple, Transit or HALimits)
Added an 'Open Recent' menu.
Updated chart theme to have uniform charts: white background and light gray grid lines (printer friendly)

Fixed Red filter = 2.0 for the CHARA VEGA spectral calibration OB (R2720)
Updated CHARA VEGA spectral configuration due to new detector setup (OB / StarList export)
Fixed Export to OIFits file(s) when the spectral type is undefined (null string values)
Fixed incorrect time indicated in moon avoidance warning message
Optimized visAmp/visPhi error computation for experimental instruments (GRAVITY, MATISSE) (multithreading)
Fixed handling of invalid target identifier(s) present in the calibrator table of Aspro2's VOTable format (SAMP) (PIVOT)
Enhanced OIFits viewer to use the configuration color mapping in multi configuration mode or the wavelength color mapping in single configuration mode

Export all OIFits files in multi configuration (one file per configuration : no merged OIFits)
Fixed SUSI station positions, baselines (North - South) and delay line maximum throw
Added preliminary support for the Sydney University Stellar Interferometer (SUSI) with PAVO instrument (2T)
